Description: Almond-shaped artificial eye with small chips missing. Perhaps faint traces of pigments visible. Material it is made of is not identified (perhaps faience or clay?). Thick layer of black resinous substance at the back with clear textile impression. The eye would have originally been placed on the orbit of a mummified individual.
Curator's comments: It is possible that artificial eyes EA 90810 and EA 90811 originally formed a pair. Published in: P.H.K. Gray, 'Artificial eyes in mummies', JEA 57 (1971) , pl. XXXIV (first row, first from the right of fig. 1)
